title: Lindsay Drake
text:
Lindsay George Drake (7 September 1949 – 21 June 2019) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s.
Playing career.
A lock forward, Drake was graded with <a href="Manly-Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles</a> and played two seasons with them between 1970–1971 and played in the <a href="1970%20NSWRFL%20season">1970 Grand Final</a>. Drake then shifted to <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George Dragons</a> for four seasons between 1972 and 1975, his last game being the <a href="1975%20NSWRFL%20season">1975 Grand Final</a>. He returned to Manly in 1977 and played with them until the end of 1979 before retiring.
Drake represented <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> in one game in 1971, that being his only representative appearance.
Death.
Drake died on 21 June 2019.
